Pleasanton.Augustin Bernal Park:
Augustin Bernal Community Park is a 237-acre (0.96 km2) park in the hills southwest of Pleasanton, California.
The park was donated to the city in 1971 by Walter S. Johnson, and connects to Pleasanton Ridge Regional Park. The park is named for Spanish settler, Augustin Bernal,to whom the land on which the park sits, was originally granted.
